ratings.comment: Professor Quinn is so caring and knowledgeable, it really warms your heart. She does a great job teaching, but if you really want to learn the content (and ASL) I encourage attending the outside of class study sessions and practicing the week's content on your own at least once a week outside of class. She was very responsive to feedback.

Prof Quinn is technological challenged and doesnt always have her trip together.. BUT this course is very easy if you put a little effort in. Very causal class. Just show up and practice the signs and youll do great. Many opportunities for EC. One exam is dropped. I ended up with 100%. She is very friendly, and funny! Loved her teaching style.

Michelle is the sweetest woman on the planet. I want to give her a 5 because of how much I like her - but the course format was a little confusing at times. I found myself confused about what the quizzes were going to be on - but that being said she offers a TON of extra credit and I easily ended up with a 97% in the class despite my confusion.

Michelle is an alright professor, pretty nice and funny. She does care about her students. Lecture notes are usually disorganized. Quizzes and exams can get tough if you don't study, homework can also be hard if you don't go to lecture. Basically, if you don't go to lecture you'll miss a lot of information because the posted notes don't help

Im shocked at her low rating; dont know what she did 3 years ago, but this semester was FAR better! Michelle truly cares about her students. She invited those who didnt have anywhere to go for Thanksgiving to her place & cried on the last day cause she was so proud of how hardworking we were. For a 2 credit, I learned a LOT. (Plus 90% get an A!)

Interesting topic! Horrible teaching style. She's very inconsistent when it comes to presenting information. She states that we need to ask questions in class but then cuts people off when students do ask questions. SHE IS VERY DISORGANIZED!!! She can be nice in person, but quite condescending via emails. I would take ASL somewhere else.

Incredibly disorganized. We could have learned so much more but she wasted time on easy concepts and meaningless activities. Her study guides were full of errors. One of the worst classes I have taken at UW Madison--and it was unfortunately in my major!

She's very nice and understanding during office hours. Class is a different story. All the material (ppt & study guides) she uses is from years ago so when she changes some of the lectures and materials-bring on the confusion. Class is very unorganized and you're never quite sure what directions are for tests or assignments... Easy class overall

Extremely disorganized. I truly feel like this was a waste of my time. Wasted hours on the easiest concepts. Quizzes are straightforward. Study guides full of language errors, test questions unclear. I'm not sure what we even learned for test 2... Very disappointed.

she's SO disorganized it blows my mind how she could still be teaching honestly. get ready to spend 30 minutes of lecture figuring out which powerpoint we're even on. uses a million examples to explain one concept. SO many distractions during the test. don't take this class if you have test anxiety and need quiet! she can be really rude too.
Terrible lecturer and very disorganized! Good luck figuring out what she wants from you on the tests. Quizzes are easy as the questions come straight from the textbook.

Quinn is a nice person, but an AWFUL lecturer!!! This class is unbearable most of the time. My classmates and I often talk about how we have no clue why she is lecturing on a topic, and what on earth she is talking about. 6 quizzes on textbook material, lowest one dropped, 2 exams on lecture material, and final "exercise."

DISORGANIZED! Starts lectures, fails to finish them in class time & then just drops the rest of the lecture & starts talking about something unrelated the following class. Confusing. Your notes & what matches up with each other will be in complete disarray. Figuring out what to study  is tough bc its unclear when she is teaching vs. story time
If you like being condescended to by someone who is late every day and doesn't even understand the material herself, then a class with Michelle Quinn might be great for you!
Although not hard at all, this is seriously the worst class I have taken in my 4 years at UW. Completely unorganized. Ridiculous amounts of class time wasted. ANNOYING, ANNOYING, ANNOYING.
AWESOME! She has a real passion for teaching and a very laid back style. Great class I would DEFINITELY recommend it :D
